answer: Man’s chief end is to glorify God, and to enjoy him forever.
question: What is the chief end of man?

verses.text: 36 For from him and through him and to him are all things. To him be glory forever. Amen.
20 for you were bought with a price. So glorify God in your body.
21 Your people shall all be righteous; they shall possess the land forever, the branch of my planting, the work of my hands, that I might be glorified.

1 Incline your ear, O Lord, and answer me, for I am poor and needy. 2 Preserve my life, for I am godly; save your servant, who trusts in you—you are my God. 3 Be gracious to me, O Lord, for to you do I cry all the day.
11 "Worthy are you, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things, and by your will they existed and were created."
2 "Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and will not be afraid; for the Lord God is my strength and my song, and he has become my salvation."

5 The Lord is my chosen portion and my cup; you hold my lot. 6 The lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; indeed, I have a beautiful inheritance. 7 I bless the Lord who gives me counsel; in the night also my heart instructs me.
15 Blessed are the people to whom such blessings fall! Blessed are the people whose God is the Lord!
10 And the angel said to them, "Fear not, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy that will be for all the people.
4 Rejoice in the Lord always; again I will say, Rejoice.

3 And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, "Behold, the dwelling place of God is with man. He will dwell with them, and they will be his people, and God himself will be with them as their God. 4 He will wipe away every tear from their eyes, and death shall be no more, neither shall there be mourning, nor crying, nor pain anymore, for the former things have passed away."

answer: The Word of God, which is contained in the Scriptures of the Old and New Testaments, is the only rule to direct us how we may glorify and enjoy him.
question: What rule hath God given to direct us how we may glorify and enjoy him?

7The law of the Lord is perfect

and preserves one’s life.

The rules set down by the Lord are reliable

and impart wisdom to the inexperienced.

8The Lord’s precepts are fair

and make one joyful.

The Lord’s commands are pure

and give insight for life.

9The commands to fear the Lord are right

and endure forever.

The judgments given by the Lord are trustworthy

and absolutely just.

10They are of greater value than gold,

than even a great amount of pure gold;

they bring greater delight than honey,

than even the sweetest honey from a honeycomb.

11Yes, your servant finds moral guidance there;

those who obey them receive a rich reward.

<sup>2</sup>I want you to recall both the predictions foretold by the holy prophets and the commandment of the Lord and Savior through your apostles.<sup>15</sup>And regard the patience of our Lord as salvation, just as also our dear brother Paul wrote to you, according to the wisdom given to him,<sup>16</sup>speaking of these things in all his letters. Some things in these letters are hard to understand, things the ignorant and unstable twist to their own destruction, as they also do to the rest of the scriptures.
<sup>11</sup>I have told you these things so that my joy may be in you, and your joy may be complete.
<sup>11</sup>These Jews were more open-minded than those in Thessalonica, for they eagerly received the message, examining the scriptures carefully every day to see if these things were so.

<sup>15</sup>and how from infancy you have known the holy writings, which are able to give you wisdom for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.<sup>16</sup>Every scripture is inspired by God and useful for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,<sup>17</sup>that the person dedicated to God may be capable and equipped for every good work.<hr/>
<sup>4</sup>Thus we are writing these things so that our joy may be complete.<hr/>

answer: The Scriptures principally teach, what man is to believe concerning God, and what duty God requires of man.
question: What do the Scriptures principally teach?

verses.text: <sup>39</sup>You study the scriptures thoroughly because you think in them you possess eternal life, and it is these same scriptures that testify about me,

<sup>8</sup>This law scroll must not leave your lips! You must memorize it day and night so you can carefully obey all that is written in it. Then you will prosper and be successful.

105נ (Nun)

Your word is a lamp to walk by,

and a light to illumine my path.

8He has told you, O man, what is good,

and what the Lord really wants from you:

He wants you to promote justice, to be faithful,

and to live obediently before your God.

<sup>31</sup>But these are recorded so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.<hr/>

answer: God is a spirit, infinite, eternal, and unchangeable, in his being, wisdom, power, holiness, justice, goodness and truth.
question: What is God?

verses.text: <sup>29</sup>So since we are God’s offspring, we should not think the deity is like gold or silver or stone, an image made by human skill and imagination.

<sup>15</sup>Be very careful, then, because you saw no form at the time the Lord spoke to you at Horeb from the middle of the fire.<sup>16</sup>I say this so you will not corrupt yourselves by making an image in the form of any kind of figure. This includes the likeness of a human male or female,<sup>17</sup>any kind of land animal, any bird that flies in the sky,<sup>18</sup>anything that crawls on the ground, or any fish in the deep waters of the earth.<sup>19</sup>When you look up to the sky and see the sun, moon, and stars – the whole heavenly creation – you must not be seduced to worship and serve them, for the Lord your God has assigned them to all the people of the world.

7Where can I go to escape your spirit?

Where can I flee to escape your presence?

8If I were to ascend to heaven, you would be there.

If I were to sprawl out in Sheol, there you would be.

9If I were to fly away on the wings of the dawn,

and settle down on the other side of the sea,

10even there your hand would guide me,

your right hand would grab hold of me.

3The Lord is great and certainly worthy of praise!

No one can fathom his greatness!

5Our Lord is great and has awesome power;

there is no limit to his wisdom.

24“Do you really think anyone can hide himself

where I cannot see him?” the Lord asks.

“Do you not know that I am everywhere?”

the Lord asks.

33Oh, the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are his judgments and how fathomless his ways!
34For who has known the mind of the Lord,

or who has been his counselor?

35Or who has first given to God,

that God needs to repay him?

36For from him and through him and to him are all things. To him be glory forever! Amen.

2Even before the mountains came into existence,

or you brought the world into being,

you were the eternal God.

27The everlasting God is a refuge,

and underneath you are his eternal arms;

he has driven out enemies before you,

and has said, “Destroy!”

12But you, O Lord, rule forever,

and your reputation endures.

24I say, “O my God, please do not take me away in the middle of my life!

You endure through all generations.

25In earlier times you established the earth;

the skies are your handiwork.

26They will perish,

but you will endure.

They will wear out like a garment;

like clothes you will remove them and they will disappear.

27But you remain;

your years do not come to an end.

his plans abide throughout the ages.
<sup>6</sup>“Since, I, the Lord, do not go back on my promises, you, sons of Jacob, have not perished.

12and like a robe you will fold them up

and like a garment they will be changed,

but you are the same and your years will never run out.”

<sup>8</sup>Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever!
<sup>17</sup>All generous giving and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or the slightest hint of change.

But he by no means leaves the guilty unpunished, responding to the transgression of fathers by dealing with children and children’s children, to the third and fourth generation.”<hr/>

for all his ways are just.

He is a reliable God who is never unjust,

he is fair and upright.

And remember, I am with you always, to the end of the age.”<hr/>
